availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Orear (Montgomery County, Kentucky, wagon maker)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, wagon maker. Kentucky native. Married to Selina Orear. Father of Carrie Orear, Albert Orear, and John Orear. Wagon marker in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 245.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 87A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Camargo Precinct, p. 246B.
"William D Orear (1827-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 115086821, accessed September 30, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/115086821.
